definitions.definition: a large, angry crowd, especially one that could easily become violent:
examples: The angry mob outside the jail was/were ready to riot.

definitions.definition: a group of people who are friends or who are similar in some way:
examples: The usual mob was/were hanging out at the bar.

definitions.definition: to come together around someone in a crowd to express admiration, interest, or anger:
examples: They were mobbed by fans when they arrived at the theatre.

definitions.definition: When birds or small animals mob a bigger or more frightening bird or animal that is hunting them, they attack it together and force it to go away.
